chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Like this video and keep your energy high.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And how you can use it to enhance your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Let's roll the intro.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So guys, I have come to my computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And now I will make a new folder named Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If you see any website, it has SEO in it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Let's take the example of Amazon.in.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I opened Amazon.in.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So that their products can come in search.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Google is a search engine.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: They present the information very well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: For example, let's say there are two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: One page has told about dog food.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: It loads well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So Google will give it more preference.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Along with that, there are core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which Google considers to rank two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: First of all, it is content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Content is the most important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: What do you have on one page?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then your core web vitals will be seen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: You see this video here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which I have run from web.dev website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: You will see that someone comes to your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And he is trying to cancel the order here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And he shifted the layout.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And the order is complete.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: But the user wanted the order to be incomplete.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: He wanted to click on no.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: In this case, the user experience is very bad.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That's why our CLS should be as low as possible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now what is the definition of CLS?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift means.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: How much is shifting while the page is loading.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Assume that you have loaded the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And first of all, you get to see this.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: It was above first.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So everything shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Layout should not shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If you put width and height in images.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then the layout will not shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: This means that if the user is viewing a page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then the biggest element on it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: For example, the biggest part in this is this image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: How long is it loading?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Means the whole page will be loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: But the biggest looking element.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which is the most important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: How long is it loading?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Assume that web.dev and Google.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: After this comes the third metric which is FID.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which stands for First Input Delay.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: First Input Delay means that.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If any user has clicked on any input element.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Like on a button or any type of input.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: On a page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So how long does that input process?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: For example, if you click on a button.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So how long does that button click browser process?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And if we assume Google and web.dev.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So in less than 100 milliseconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Your input should start processing.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So these were the three core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which are very important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: For your information.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: These core web vitals are updated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: But these three are very important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And you should know.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now I will show you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: What is the lighthouse report?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And why do they generate?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And how will these three core web vitals get value from there?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So I will tell you here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If you will inspect by right clicking.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And you may be coming to the right side.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So you can click here and bring it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: By clicking here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If you want, you can bring it here again.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And by clicking here, you can bring it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I prefer it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Because I am used to seeing it down from the starting.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now you can see the option of lighthouse here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Lighthouse basically generates a report for you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And tells you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: What can be improved in your HTML page?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: For example, if I want to see here on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: How mobile users see my website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So I will click on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Or I will click on desktop.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I will close this tab.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I will click on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And I will click on analyze page load.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So this will generate a report.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Lighthouse for me.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: You can see here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That a report has been generated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: In this, performance, accessibility.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Best practices, SE and PWA.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: All these things are being shown.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now here you can see.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Some things are shown in red.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That is, the scope of improvement is in the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now here you are telling.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That size your images properly.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Your website can be loaded 2.7 seconds fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So all these suggestions.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: They are given to you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Through lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And if you incorporate these suggestions.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then your website will be loaded quite well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And will give a good experience to the user.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now you can see here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Image elements do not have explicit width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So you should give width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: The image width and height attribute.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Which we read in the last video.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That should be used.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So that in your browser.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: There is a reserve space.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: When we set width and height in HTML.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then there is a reserve space in the browser.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Otherwise if we do not set height and width.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then what will happen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That our browser.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: It will not know how much space to reserve.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And as long as the CSS will load.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: All the page will shift from bottom to top.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So we don't want our page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Shift in loading time.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: If our page starts shifting.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So if we are going to click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So by mistake when it shifts.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Then we can click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Suppose an image was going to come here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I am going to click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And as long as I clicked.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: During that time this image was loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And all this content shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And instead of clicking here by mistake.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: I will click on the image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: This is called cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So this kind of shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Is not preferred at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Google does not prefer at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And this should be the least.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: You can see that the space is very less.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So we have to keep the cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So that our user.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Can get a very good experience.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So here are many more suggestions.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And this is for our mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now we can generate a desktop report.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: And the desktop report will be generated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: So as you can see.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That it has generated a report.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: 92 marks in performance.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: 100 out of 82 in accessibility.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: 75 in best practices.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: 75 in SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: Now you see here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That the good things.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML ｜ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6
chunks.text: That have been told here.

text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important. Like this video and keep your energy high. The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4. Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website. In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse. And how you can use it to enhance your website. So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP. Let's go to the computer screen. Let's roll the intro. So guys, I have come to my computer screen. And now I will make a new folder named Video 6. Video 6. And here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always. And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO. First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is. SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. If you see any website, it has SEO in it. Let's take the example of Amazon.in. I opened Amazon.in. So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible. So that their products can come in search. Google is a search engine. Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users. So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast. They present the information very well. And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience. For example, let's say there are two pages. One page has told about dog food. The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food. But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast. It loads well. So Google will give it more preference. Along with that, there are core web vitals. Which Google considers to rank two pages. First of all, it is content. Content is the most important. What do you have on one page? If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals. But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content. Then your core web vitals will be seen. And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference. So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS. You see this video here. Which I have run from web.dev website. You will see that someone comes to your website. And he is trying to cancel the order here. And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible. And he shifted the layout. And the order is complete. But the user wanted the order to be incomplete. He wanted to click on no. In this case, the user experience is very bad. And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this. That's why our CLS should be as low as possible. Now what is the definition of CLS? Cumulative layout shift means. How much is shifting while the page is loading. Assume that you have loaded the page. And first of all, you get to see this. It was above first. And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded. So everything shifted down. Layout should not shift. If you put width and height in images. Then the layout will not shift. The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP. And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint. This means that if the user is viewing a page. Then the biggest element on it. For example, the biggest part in this is this image. How long is it loading? Means the whole page will be loaded. But the biggest looking element. Which is the most important. How long is it loading? Assume that web.dev and Google. A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds. Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds. After this comes the third metric which is FID. Which stands for First Input Delay. First Input Delay means that. If any user has clicked on any input element. Like on a button or any type of input. On a page. So how long does that input process? For example, if you click on a button. So how long does that button click browser process? And if we assume Google and web.dev. So in less than 100 milliseconds. Your input should start processing. So these were the three core web vitals. Which are very important. For your information. These core web vitals are updated. But these three are very important. And you should know. Now I will show you. What is the lighthouse report? And why do they generate? And how will these three core web vitals get value from there? So I will tell you here. If you will inspect by right clicking. And you may be coming to the right side. So you can click here and bring it down. By clicking here. If you want, you can bring it here again. And by clicking here, you can bring it down. I prefer it down. Because I am used to seeing it down from the starting. Now you can see the option of lighthouse here. Lighthouse basically generates a report for you. And tells you. What can be improved in your HTML page? For example, if I want to see here on mobile. How mobile users see my website. So I will click on mobile. Or I will click on desktop. I will close this tab. I will click on mobile. And I will click on analyze page load. So this will generate a report. Lighthouse for me. You can see here. That a report has been generated. In this, performance, accessibility. Best practices, SE and PWA. All these things are being shown. Now here you can see. Some things are shown in red. That is, the scope of improvement is in the page. Now here you are telling. That size your images properly. Your website can be loaded 2.7 seconds fast. So all these suggestions. They are given to you. Through lighthouse. And if you incorporate these suggestions. Then your website will be loaded quite well. And will give a good experience to the user. Now you can see here. Image elements do not have explicit width and height. So you should give width and height. The image width and height attribute. Which we read in the last video. That should be used. So that in your browser. There is a reserve space. When we set width and height in HTML. Then there is a reserve space in the browser. Otherwise if we do not set height and width. Then what will happen. That our browser. It will not know how much space to reserve. And as long as the CSS will load. All the page will shift from bottom to top. So we don't want our page. Shift in loading time. If our page starts shifting. So if we are going to click here. So by mistake when it shifts. And instead of clicking here by mistake. I will click on the image. This is called cumulative layout shift. So this kind of shift. Is not preferred at all. Google does not prefer at all.
